discussion.content: There were frame relay questions in the 200-105 exam I took yesterday!
There is no frame relay in 200-105 v3
Answer- B. IP addresses can be conserved if VLSM is not being used for subnetting. should remove "NOT" then it would be worded correctly

questions.answer_description: you do not have to assign a separate subnet per sub-interface. If you're using a Class A network (10.x.x.x/8), you blow the whole network on a few connections (if you used VLSM, you could use a better mask, limit the addresses used). if you used 10.0.0.0/8, you would not be assigning the entire /8 to a single network. You would select a subnet mask for the network and then, you would have to use that mask with all subnets of the network. So if you chose a /24 mask, that would mean that you would have to use a /24 mask for even point-to-point links.
questions.question_text: What is the advantage of using a multipoint interface instead of point-to-point subinterfaces when configuring a Frame Relay hub in a hub-and-spoke topology?

choices.D: The multiple IP network addresses required for a multipoint interface provide greater addressing flexibility over point-to-point configurations.
choices.B: IP addresses can be conserved if VLSM is not being used for subnetting.
choices.A: It avoids split-horizon issues with distance vector routing protocols.
choices.C: A multipoint interface offers greater security compared to point-to-point subinterface configurations.

discussion.content:

comments.content: APIC-EM Path Trace ACL --->>>>>> Analysis tool <<<-------------

choices.B: It can determine whether traffic along a specific path will be filtered
choices.A: It can identify the path between two specified IP addresses
choices.E: It applies the ACLs from a specified path to permit and deny incoming traffic
choices.D: It can create and modify access lists in a private cloud infrastructure
choices.C: It can manage access lists in an SDN environment

questions.question_text: Which two functions of the APIC-EM Path Trace ACL Analysis tool are true? (Choose two.)
When you configure a new switch interface, to which VLAN it is automatically assigned?

choices.B: it checks the timestamp on ICMP Echo messages
choices.A: it checks the timestamp on source and destination ICMP Time Exceeded messages
choices.D: It checks the one-way delay of each ICMP Echo packet received
choices.C: it calculates the time that elapses from when the device sends an ICMP Echo request to when it receives an ICMP Echo reply

discussion.content:
The Correct answer is C. 
Response time is computed by measuring the time taken between "sending an ICMP Echo request message to the destination and receiving an ICMP Echo reply".

comments.content: Sorry for the typo. Yes answer is C

discussion.content: According to the explanation navnvt, the answer should be C.

I think the correct answer is B.

The ICMP Echo IP SLA Operation measures end-to-end response time between a Cisco router and any device with an IP Address. The response time is computed by measuring the time taken between sending an ICMP Echo request and receiving an Echo reply.
